alert.note: Alert for Newport News; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Gloucester, north central Isle of Wight, central York, Mathews, southeastern James City and eastern Surry Counties and the northern City of Newport News through 430 PM EDT... At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Surry, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Mathews, Gloucester Courthouse, Surry, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Gloucester Point, Seaford, Busch Gardens, Hayes, Carver Gardens, Elberon, Kings Point, Wicomico, Achilles, Bavon, York Terrace, Lee Hall, Denbigh and Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Virginia.
